<|SEP|> chess boards with C64 squares arranged in an 8x8 grid.
<|SEP|> 64 squares arranged in an 8x8 grid. The players...
<|SEP|> arranged in an 8x8 grid. The players referred to as white
<|SEP|> in an 8x8 grid. The players, referred to as "White" and "Black"
<|SEP|> The players, referred to as "White" and "Black", each controls six-
<|SEP|> The players, referred to as "White" and "Black", each control 16 pieces.
<|SEP|> referred to as white and black. Each controls 16 pieces. One king.
<|SEP|> in black. Each controls 16 pieces. One king, one queen.
<|SEP|> Each controls 16 pieces. One king, one queen, two rooks.
<|SEP|> pieces one king one queen two rooks two bishops
<|SEP|> one king, one queen, two rooks, two bishops, two knights.
<|SEP|> One queen, two rooks, two bishops, two knights, and eight pawns.
<|SEP|> two rooks, two bishops, two knights, and eight pawns.
<|SEP|> two bishops, two knights, and eight pawns. White moves first.
<|SEP|> Two knights see eight pawns. White moves first, followed by black.
<|SEP|> and eight pawns. White moves first, followed by black. The game is won.
<|SEP|> White moves first, followed by black. The game is won by checkmating.
<|SEP|> moves first, followed by black. The game is won by checkmating the opponent's
